definition: to do whatever one pleases
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
desire/appetite/passion/lust/greed
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: An absolute ruler can do just as he please.
sentences.chinese: 一个专制的统治者可以为所欲为。

sentences.english: January 10 Treating others with love does not necessarily mean allowing others to do as they wish.
sentences.chinese: 以爱待人并不意味着让他人为所欲为。

sentences.english: You are in the collar now. You know marriage has its obligation.
sentences.chinese: 现在你不能为所欲为了，你知道结婚要承担义务的。

sentences.english: The site is huge. You can do whatever you want.
sentences.chinese: 哈姆达尼说，“遗址巨大无比，你可以为所欲为。”

sentences.english: His charm and the fact that he is so likeable often allows him to get away with murder .
sentences.chinese: 他很有魅力而且讨人喜欢，这常让他能够为所欲为。

sentences.english: You can't do as you want relying on power, or you may invite a nemesis.
sentences.chinese: 你们不能怙恃权势就为所欲为，小心遭报应。

sentences.english: The teacher's so weak that the children do what they like.
sentences.chinese: 这老师太软弱了，孩子们因此可以为所欲为。

sentences.english: Said differently, guys try to get women to like them by doing whatever the woman wants.
sentences.chinese: 换个说法就是，男人让女人为所欲为来讨取她的欢心。

sentences.english: Do you think everybody gets their way so easily?
sentences.chinese: 你以为每个人都能那么轻易地为所欲为吗？

sentences.english: What makes you think you can just walk in there and fnd what we need?
sentences.chinese: 你凭什么以为自己能大摇大摆地走进去为所欲为呢？

definition: see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]

absolutely unrestrained/unbridled/without the slightest scruple
to behave unscrupulously
to take rash action
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to indulge/to connive at
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
prerogative/privilege/privileged
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
not stopping at anything/all manner of evil
